content: Compose a sonnet about springtime, ensuring each line begins with a different letter of the alphabet.

Awakening buds in emerald hues unfold,
Beneath the azure sky, so vast and bold.
Crocuses peer from earth's warm, tender hold,
Daisies dance where winter's chill has rolled.

Each breeze brings scents of flowers newly born,
Filling the air with fragrances untold.
Gentle rains have nourished seeds forlorn,
Heralding life in every sprout and mold.

In fields where last year's leaves lay still and cold,
Jasmines now perfume the morning's gold.
Kites soar high on thermals young and bold,
Larks sing sweetly, their melodies are told.

Meadows burst with colors, bright and bold,
Nature's symphony, in springtime, is retold.
